remarks: If a set A of real functions from a common domain T is a subalgebra and it contains constants, then it is closed under the sum of a finite number of functions, indexed by G and finally scaled by a real Y. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem32.1 $e |- F/ t ph $.
stoweidlem32.2 $e |- P = ( t e. T |-> ( Y x. sum_ i e. ( 1 ... M ) ( ( G ` i ) ` t ) ) ) $.
stoweidlem32.3 $e |- F = ( t e. T |-> sum_ i e. ( 1 ... M ) ( ( G ` i ) ` t ) ) $.
stoweidlem32.4 $e |- H = ( t e. T |-> Y ) $.
stoweidlem32.5 $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
stoweidlem32.6 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. RR ) $.
stoweidlem32.7 $e |- ( ph -> G : ( 1 ... M ) --> A ) $.
stoweidlem32.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) + ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem32.9 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A /\ g e. A ) -> ( t e. T |-> ( ( f ` t ) x. ( g ` t ) ) ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem32.10 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. RR ) -> ( t e. T |-> x ) e. A ) $.
stoweidlem32.11 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A ) -> f : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem32 $p |- ( ph -> P e. A ) $.
$d A f g $.
$d A x $.
$d F f g $.
$d G f g i t $.
$d G i t $.
$d H g $.
$d M i t $.
$d T f g i t $.
$d T i t $.
$d T t x $.
$d Y t $.
$d Y t x $.
$d f g i ph $.
$d ph x $.
